patients.name: David R.
patients.bio: David initially dismissed early symptoms as work-related stress. After a challenging diagnostic journey, he's now actively managing his CIDP through regular IVIg treatments while maintaining his career in software development.

cards.quote: It started with just some tingling in my feet. I ignored it for weeks thinking it would go away. Looking back, I wish I had acted sooner.
cards.contextDescription: David experienced initial symptoms but delayed seeking medical attention, a common pattern in early CIDP.
cards.goals: Maintain career while managing treatment schedule, regain strength and mobility
cards.strengths: Strong support system, employer flexibility, technical background helping research
cards.anxieties: Long-term prognosis, treatment effectiveness, maintaining work-life balance

cards.quote: After six different doctors and countless tests, someone finally connected the dots. The journey to diagnosis felt endless.
cards.contextDescription: David's path to diagnosis involved multiple healthcare providers and specialists before reaching a definitive CIDP diagnosis.

cards.quote: Finding the right treatment combination took time, but the improvements have been worth the effort.
cards.contextDescription: David's treatment journey showing response to different therapeutic approaches.

patients.name: Patricia K.
patients.bio: Patricia's CIDP diagnosis came after a rapid decline in mobility. Now stabilized on treatment, she advocates for better CIDP awareness and supports newly diagnosed patients.

cards.quote: The EMG was uncomfortable, but it finally gave us answers. Having a diagnosis meant we could start fighting back.
cards.contextDescription: Patricia began her treatment journey with determination after receiving a clear diagnosis.
cards.goals: Maintain independence, support other CIDP patients, optimize treatment routine
cards.strengths: Medical knowledge from personal research, strong advocacy skills, resilient attitude
cards.anxieties: Future mobility, treatment longevity, impact on family life

cards.quote: Managing CIDP is like a full-time job. Between treatments, exercises, and monitoring symptoms, it takes constant vigilance.
cards.contextDescription: Patricia has developed a comprehensive approach to managing her CIDP, balancing treatment with daily life.

cards.quote: Keeping track of my symptoms helps me communicate better with my healthcare team.
cards.contextDescription: Patricia's systematic tracking of CIDP symptoms over time reveals patterns and treatment effectiveness.
